intro: Phyllosma capensis, commonly known as the Cape phyllosma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Phyllosma capensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in Mediterranean climates.
